description: Listed only by Irwin, who says: �A manual 16' Flute, and pedal 32' Flute, of either open or stopped construction. The manual stop may be a Doppelflöte.� Examples Only two examples are known: Double Flute 8', Great, Swell, Ethereal, Orchestral; John Wanamaker Store, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, USA. (This example is made of wood, and is probably a Doppelflöte.) Double Flute 16', Pedal, Great, Accompaniment; Riverview Roller Rink and Ballroom, Milwaukee, Wisconsin, USA; Wurlitzer. (This is almost certainly an ordinary open flute.) Bibliography Irwin[1]: Double Flute. FOOTER Original site compiled by Edward L. Stauff. For educational use only.
